meanings.definition: Officially recognized as a saint by the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The canonized saint is celebrated every year on their feast day.
meanings.sent2: The community gathered to honor the canonized saint with prayers and hymns.
meanings.sent3: The children dressed up as the canonized saint for Halloween, bringing smiles to everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity were so remarkable that she was like a canonized saint in the eyes of the villagers.
meanings.sent5: The statue of the canonized saint stood tall in the church, a symbol of faith and devotion.

meanings.sent1: The canonized rules were followed by everyone in the organization.
meanings.sent2: The textbook became the canonized source of information for the students.
meanings.sent3: His fashion sense was so unique that it became the canonized style among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The old library was a canonized place for quiet study and reflection.
meanings.sent5: Her recipe for apple pie was considered the canonized version among her family and friends.
